intro: Neocuatrecasia epapposa, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Neocuatrecasia epapposa is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed environments.
